page.syntax: Output_String as C = STRITRAN(C character,C substring,[C replacement,[N start_pos,[N occurrences[,N every]]]])

argument.name: Output_String
argument.description: The character string produced by the replacement operation.

argument.name: substring
argument.description: The string to find in the Search_String.

argument.name: replacement
argument.description: Optional. Default = "" (NULL). The string that replaces the Find_String.

argument.name: start_pos
argument.description: Optional. Default = 1. Specifies which (and subsequent) occurrences will be replaced. A value N for the optional Start_Position begins the replacement at the N th occurrence of Find_String. Numeric

argument.name: occurrences
argument.description: Optional. Default = All. Specifies the maximum number of occurrences of Find_String to replace with Replace_String. Numeric

argument.name: every
argument.description: Optional. Default = 1. Specifies the interval between replacements. Numeric

page.description: Replaces each occurrence of a string with another - compare is case insensitive.
page.discussion: Replaces every occurrence of Find_String in Search_String with a Replace_String. STRITRAN() is not case sensitive. Note : You can use STRITRAN() with memo fields.
page.example: stritran("The Road Not Traveled", "Traveled", "Paved") -> "The Road Not Paved" stritran("I much prefer cats", "cats", "dogs") -> "I much prefer dogs"

section.description: You can use STRITRAN() to remove a specific Find_String from anywhere within another Search_String. For example, to index a field containing titles, without the article "The", you might use the following expression:
section.example: stritran(EVENT, "The ", "", 1, 1) -> "Kentucky Derby" if EVENT stores "The Kentucky Derby".

section.description: This then places "Kentucky Derby" near the other events starting with "K" instead of with the events starting with "T". The following example replaces every second letter "e" in the search string.
section.example: dim string as C string = "this is the number one replacement function" ? stritran(string, "e", "|", 1, 99, 2) = "this is th| number on| replac|ment function"

section.description: Expressions cannot exceed 1024 characters. as a result, it can be impossible to insert a variable into a long string with character addition. This example shows how to insert a variable into a long character string by replacing a unique placeholder ( myvar ).
section.example: a = ...long string... myvar ...long string... %str% a = stritran(a, myvar, variable)
